# The `MemorySSA` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Encapsulates <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a>, including all data associated with memory accesses. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Encapsulates <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a>, including all data associated with memory accesses.

### ensureOptimizedUses() {#acd30a2d319950c138d97d5b3356342b5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void MemorySSA::ensureOptimizedUses ()">
By default, uses are <em>not</em> optimized during <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> construction.

Calling this method will attempt to optimize all MemoryUses, if this has not happened yet for this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> instance. This should be done if you plan to query the clobbering access for most uses, or if you walk the def-use chain of uses.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h/#l00797">797</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp/#l02200">2200</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp">MemorySSA.cpp</a>.

### isLiveOnEntryDef() {#ae3b89ffde42778289bcbd8a187199420}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::MemorySSA::isLiveOnEntryDef (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42; MA) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if <code>MA</code> represents the live on entry value.

Loads and stores from pointer arguments and other global values may be defined by memory operations that do not occur in the current function, so they may be live on entry to the function. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> represents such memory state by the live on entry definition, which is guaranteed to occur before any other memory access in the function.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h/#l00739">739</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### renumberBlock() {#a2e0f168aba3bdf8cc523a0b7bb29fb6f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSA::renumberBlock (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; B) const</>}>
Perform a local numbering on blocks so that instruction ordering can be determined in constant time.

TODO: We currently just number in order. If we numbered by N, we could allow at least N-1 sequences of insertBefore or insertAfter (and at least log2(N) sequences of mixed before and after) without needing to invalidate the numbering.
